me":"result","type":"uint8"}],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_newThreshold","type":"uint256"}],"name":"proposeChangeCurrentAdminConfirmationThreshold","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint8","name":"result","type":"uint8"}],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_revokeAdministratorAddress","type":"address"}],"name":"revokeAdministrator","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint8","name":"result","type":"uint8"}],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_genericExtraDataAddress","type":"address"}],"name":"setGenericTrustAnchorExtraDataAddress","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint8","name":"result","type":"uint8"}],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_newAdministratorAddress","type":"address"}],"name":"setPrimaryAdministrator","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint8","name":"result","type":"uint8"}],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_uniqueExtraDataAddress","type":"address"}],"name":"setUniqueTrustAnchorExtraDataAddress","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint8","name":"result","type":"uint8"}],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_shyftConduitAddress","type":"address"}],"name":"setupShyftConduit","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint8","name":"result","type":"uint8"}],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint16","name":"_newJurisdiction","type":"uint16"}],"name":"setupTrustAnchorJurisdiction","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint8","name":"result","type":"uint8"}],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"shyftConduitAddress","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"_trustAnchorAddress","type":"address"}],"name":"verifyTrustAnchor","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint8","name":"result","type":"uint8"}],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"events":{"EVT_GettingJurisdictionFromTrustAnchor(uint16,address)":{"details":"Event for getting the Jurisdiction for a Trust Anchor."},"EVT_JurisdictionDoesRequireChange(address)":{"details":"Event for a Trust Anchor requiring multisignature permission before a Jurisdiction change."},"EVT_onboardTrustAnchor(address)":{"details":"Event for onboarding a Trust Anchor."},"EVT_setGenericTrustAnchorExtraDataAddress(address)":{"details":"Event for setting up a generic Trust Anchor's ExtraData fields."},"EVT_setUniqueTrustAnchorExtraDataAddress(address,address)":{"details":"Event for setting up a unique Trust Anchor's ExtraData fields."},"EVT_verifyTrustAnchor(address)":{"details":"Event for verifying a Trust Anchor."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"approveChange(address)":{"details":"| Approves the change to a Jurisdiction for a Trust Anchor.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.","params":{"_trustAnchorAddress":"Trust Anchor public address to confirm a change of Jurisdiction."},"returns":{"result":"   | 0 = not administrator    | 1 = no trust anchor found    | 2 = no jurisdiction change necessary    | 3 = jurisdiction change occurred"}},"changeCurrentAdminConfirmationThreshold(uint32)":{"details":"| This function takes in an index for a proposal ot change the current administrator confirmation threshold.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.","params":{"_proposalIndex":"The index for a specific proposal to change the current administrator confirmation threshold."},"returns":{"result":"   | 0 = not an administrator    | 1 = invalid proposal index    | 2 = not enough administrators to achieve confirmation threshold    | 3 = proposal has expired    | 4 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 5 = admin confirmation threshold set"}},"constructor":{"details":"Initializes Trust Anchor Manager with the owner set to the calling public address."},"demoteTrustAnchor(address)":{"details":"| Demotes Trust Anchor, using a public address.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.","params":{"_trustAnchorAddress":"The smart contract address for the trust anchor that should be demoted."},"returns":{"result":"   | 0 = not administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = trust anchor not verified status    | 3 = trust anchor successfully demoted"}},"getAdminAccess(address)":{"details":"Gets the level of access for a specific administrator.","returns":{"result":"the level of access for this administrator"}},"getAdminConfirmationProposal(uint32)":{"details":"Gets the components of a specific NofM change proposal.","params":{"_proposalIndex":"A proposal index"},"returns":{"adminThreshold":"the threshold of the NofM voting within this proposal","endTime":"the end time of this proposal, after which it cannot be voted on","isCompleted":"whether this proposal has been completed by multisig parties"}},"getAdminConfirmationThreshold()":{"details":"Gets the NofM threshold currently required for passing multisig votes.","returns":{"results":"the current NofM threshold"}},"getGenericTrustAnchorExtraDataAddress()":{"details":"| Gets the generic ExtraData that would be useful to all of the Trust Anchors associated to this smart contract, mediated by the administrators of this smart contract.      | An example of this \"ExtraData\" would be the web2.0 ip addresses that correspond to data retrieval of end user's PII according to the consent rules.","returns":{"result":"returns the generic extraData smart contract address"}},"getNumAdminConfirmationProposals()":{"details":"Gets the number of a specific NofM change proposal.","returns":{"result":"the number of a specific NofM proposals"}},"getPermissionsForMultisignKey(bytes32)":{"details":"Gets whether there have been a specific number of multisignature confirmations for a specific vote.","params":{"_keyKeccak":"A hash to reference as the key/value vote subject."},"returns":{"result":"0 to numAdministrators = #confirmations"}},"getTrustAnchorAddress(uint32)":{"details":"Gets the public address of a Trust Anchor, using an Index. This public address.","params":{"_trustAnchorIndex":"The Index that is checked for the public address for this Trust Anchor."},"returns":{"result":"the public address of this trust anchor"}},"getTrustAnchorIndex(address)":{"details":"| Gets the Index of a Trust Anchor, using a public address. This Index is a simple integer value      | that relates to the order of Trust Anchors that have been onboarded into this contract.","params":{"_trustAnchorAddress":"The smart contract address that is checked for the Index for this Trust Anchor."},"returns":{"result":"   | 0 -> 2^32-1 = index of trust anchor"}},"getTrustAnchorJurisdiction(address)":{"details":"Gets the Jurisdiction for a Trust Anchor. Any invalid Trust Ancors will return 0.","params":{"_trustAnchorAddress":"Trust Anchor public address to get the Jurisdiction of."},"returns":{"result":"   | 0 -> 2 ** 16 - 2 = jurisdiction found    | 2 ** 16 - 1 = no jurisdiction found"}},"getUniqueTrustAnchorExtraDataAddress(address)":{"details":"| Gets the \"ExtraData\" smart contract address for a Trust Anchor. This points to another smart contract which can handle variable data that can evolve over time without impacting this contract, mediated by the Trust Anchor themselves.      | Some examples of this \"ExtraData\" would be any local regulatory requirements (web 2.0 links, embedded files, signatures from regulators, etc) that would need to be fulfilled, other examples would include smart contract addresses that link to blockchain systems that are not Shyft but are compliance-related.","params":{"_trustAnchorAddress":"Trust Anchor public address to get the Jurisdiction of."},"returns":{"result":"the smart contract address associated to a specific trust anchor that will contain any other data relevant to its functioning"}},"hasTrustAnchorBeenVerified(address)":{"details":"Checks whether a Trust Anchor has ever been verified (could currently be Demoted, but must have been Verified at least once in the past), using a public address.","params":{"_trustAnchorAddress":"The smart contract address that is checked for Verified status."},"returns":{"result":"   | false = has not been verified    | true = has been verified"}},"isAdministrator(address)":{"details":"Returns whether a given address is an administrator.","params":{"_administratorAddress":"The public address of a specific administrator."},"returns":{"result":"   | true = is administrator    | false = either administrator unset or demoted"}},"isConfirmationsIsOverThreshold(uint256)":{"details":"Returns whether a reference number is over the system's administrator confirmation threshold (ie. the vote passes).","params":{"_confirmationNumber":"A number to reference as the confirmation number"},"returns":{"result":"   | true = is over threshold    | false = not over threshold"}},"isPrimeRevocationManager(address)":{"details":"| The Prime Revocation Address is one which is set in the internal Shyft Core architecture.      | This Prime Revocation Address is responsible & allowed to perform revocations for edge-cases, such as a malicious Trust Anchor that has been forcibly removed from the system without it clearing its attestations beforehand.","params":{"_primeRevocationManagerAddress":"A public address to check for equality to the Prime Revocation Address."},"returns":{"result":"   | true = is the prime revocation address    | false = is not the prime revocation address"}},"isTrustAnchorVerified(address)":{"details":"Checks whether a Trust Anchor is verified, using a public address.","params":{"_trustAnchorAddress":"The smart contract address that is checked for Verified status."},"returns":{"result":"   | false = not verified    | true = is verified"}},"onboardTrustAnchor(address)":{"details":"| Onboards a Trust Anchor, using a public address.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.","params":{"_trustAnchorAddress":"The smart contract address for the trust anchor that should be onboarded."},"returns":{"result":"   | 0 = not administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = trust anchor not unknown status, or is zero address    | 3 = trust anchor onboarded"}},"promoteAdministrator(address)":{"details":"| Promotes a new administrator. If there is only a primary Administrator set, this will allow the addition of the second administrator and enable multisignature requirements for any actions of this contract (or those inheriting it).      | Uses Multi-signature permissions if there is more than one Administrator onboarded.","params":{"_newAdministratorAddress":"The new Administrator's public address."},"returns":{"result":"   | 0 = not administrator    | 1 = administrator already promoted    | 2 = new administrator promoted    | 3 = added vote to promote administrator"}},"proposeChangeCurrentAdminConfirmationThreshold(uint256)":{"details":"This function proposes a change to the threshold of voting required (N signatories of M total set size = NofM). To prevent stale inattention results, timeout after 2 days.","params":{"_newThreshold":"The new threshold (N of M multisig) that is needed to be passed."},"returns":{"result":"   | 0 = not an administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators to achieve confirmation threshold    | 2 = new proposal added"}},"revokeAdministrator(address)":{"details":"| Revokes an existing administrator from the multisignature set, checks to see if the # of required votes would be higher then the administrator set size, and if so adjusts to match.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions if there is more than one Administrator onboarded.","params":{"_revokeAdministratorAddress":"An existing Administrator's public address."},"returns":{"result":"result"}},"setGenericTrustAnchorExtraDataAddress(address)":{"details":"| Sets the generic ExtraData that would be useful to all of the Trust Anchors associated to this smart contract, mediated by the administrators of this smart contract.      | An example of this \"ExtraData\" would be the web2.0 ip addresses that correspond to data retrieval of end user's PII according to the consent rules.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.","params":{"_genericExtraDataAddress":"The smart contract address that contains additional functionality/variables that are useful to the Shyft ecosystem. All Trust Anchors set up in this contract would find these useful."},"returns":{"result":"   | 0 = not administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = invalid extraData address    | 3 = set generic extraData address"}},"setPrimaryAdministrator(address)":{"details":"Sets the primary Administrator for this contract (or those that inherit from it). This transfers ownership of this contracts first administration duties (to find and onboard a second party for multisignature requirements) to the set Administrator's public address.","params":{"_newAdministratorAddress":"The new Administrator's public address."},"returns":{"result":"   | 0 = not owner    | 1 = already set first administrator    | 2 = setup first administrator"}},"setUniqueTrustAnchorExtraDataAddress(address)":{"details":"| Sets the \"ExtraData\" smart contract address for a Trust Anchor. This points to another smart contract which can handle variable data that can evolve over time without impacting this contract, this function call is mediated by the Trust Anchor themselves.      | Some examples of this \"ExtraData\" would be any local regulatory requirements (web 2.0 links, embedded files, signatures from regulators, etc) that would need to be fulfilled, other examples would include smart contract addresses that link to blockchain systems that are not Shyft but are compliance-related.","params":{"_uniqueExtraDataAddress":"The smart contract address that contains additional functionality/variables that are useful to the Shyft ecosystem, but are not included in the generic ExtraData."},"returns":{"result":"   | 0 = sender is not a valid trust anchor    | 1 = set trust anchor specific extraData"}},"setupShyftConduit(address)":{"details":"| Links Shyft Conduit to this contract's function flow.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.","params":{"_shyftConduitAddress":"The smart contract address for the Shyft Conduit that should be linked."},"returns":{"result":"   | 0: not administrator    | 1: could not set conduit address    | 2: set conduit address"}},"setupTrustAnchorJurisdiction(uint16)":{"details":"| Sets up a Jurisdiction for a Trust Anchor, contract is called by the Trust Anchors themselves.      | Requires multisignature approval for changing jurisdiction.","params":{"_newJurisdiction":"Jurisdiction to be set for a specific Trust Anchor."},"returns":{"result":"   | 0 = not verified    | 1 = jurisdiction already set, now waiting for approval    | 2 = trust anchor jurisdiction has been set up first time"}},"verifyTrustAnchor(address)":{"details":"| Verifies Trust Anchor, using a public address. Onboarded and Verified are seperate processes to keep track of Trust Anchors that may be temporarily Demoted.      | Also useful as the pattern 1. Onboarded -> 2. Trust Anchor sets their own \"extraData\" which contains details that are required (for regulations etc.) -> 3. Administrators vote to have Trust Anchors fully verified having examined the data in the extraData smart contract pointer.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.","params":{"_trustAnchorAddress":"The smart contract address for the trust anchor that should be verified."},"returns":{"result":"   | 0 = not administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = trust anchor not onboarded status    | 3 = trust anchor verified"}}},"stateVariables":{"NoJurisdiction":{"details":"Base constant for no Jurisdiction set, the default for all Verified Trust Anchors."},"genericExtraDataAddress":{"details":"Mapping for a generic system-wide extra data smart contract (ex: ENS-like registration for web2.0 ip addresses for data retrieval)."},"jurisdictions":{"details":"Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses to Jurisdictions."},"jurisdictionsRequiringChange":{"details":"Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses to Jurisdictions requiring permissions to change."},"numTrustAnchors":{"details":"Number of Trust Anchors in this Trust Anchor Manager."},"shyftConduitAddress":{"details":"The Shyft Conduit public address, set post-initialization using multisignature."},"trustAnchorAccess":{"details":"Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses the enum of TrustAnchorAccess to keep track of system permission status."},"trustAnchorIndexToAddressMap":{"details":"Mapping for Trust Anchor Indexes to public addresses."},"trustAnchorIndexes":{"details":"Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses to Indexes."},"uniqueExtraDataAddress":{"details":"Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses to smart contracts that define the Trust Anchor's extra data (Trust-Anchor specific data, like regulator-specific requirements)."}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"changeCurrentAdminConfirmationThreshold(uint32)":{"notice":"Multiple proposals can be constructed for different sets to apply to change the administrator threshold. As the permissions for multisig keys use a voting set nonce underneath the hood, a change in the current administrator set will cancel all current votes."},"getPermissionsForMultisignKey(bytes32)":{"notice":"Uses composition features (based on current validator set) so data structure may be orphaned when promotion/demotion events occur."},"promoteAdministrator(address)":{"notice":"| Uses composition features (based on current validator set) so data structure may be orphaned when promotion/demotion events occur.         | Whenever this function is called (with a passing vote), there will be a re-hashing of the voting set nonce, so all current votes will become invalidated."},"revokeAdministrator(address)":{"notice":"| Uses composition features (based on current validator set) so data structure may be orphaned when promotion/demotion events occur.         | Whenever this function is called (with a passing vote), there will be a re-hashing of the voting set nonce, so all current votes will become invalidated."}},"notice":"| Administrators of this contract are able to be set in order to allow for better management practices, with multi-signature support from the Administrable contract.","version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"project:/contracts/TrustAnchorManager.sol":"TrustAnchorManager"},"evmVersion":"istanbul","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"project:/contracts/Administrable.sol":{"keccak256":"0xa21e5db848eab4d7f865b457cae5be2460bbd4b04aa985e864c26a7cb1a4eda9","license":"UNLICENSED","urls":["bzz-raw://684cd6ba507965edd27ae2861b98a891c71fd910d072e2519a2b2746192db942","dweb:/ipfs/Qmb8VEFKC3VygRJVYDiF3X48n2qJBnoTPYNmsGL6bW1Nk1"]},"project:/contracts/ECRecovery.sol":{"keccak256":"0x0ba3fd23f9279e63dc8c82cc74bf9b2edc615b8576fa54f2418450926773b138","license":"UNLICENSED","urls":["bzz-raw://e59bc345b8e6254669251a0f0f063ff14f6c6f6cd1df2a8fc44ebcefa374b398","dweb:/ipfs/Qmep98PGMuXuzGdYEDtxRw3iWFUtHcYU88hrXVHQF7fYRR"]},"project:/contracts/Interfaces/IShyftConduit.sol":{"keccak256":"0xd057f83673cf036c041c9a065512f0fb54c378eb6633251673e3fb1334c5900c","license":"UNLICENSED","urls":["bzz-raw://1f5c61b1ab8c6f86f1595c8d3c29056312c33096a96c1ddedbc448a6b51f1407","dweb:/ipfs/QmREQ5ARCgWVgrmPUvowoXBNdifTFkoKWhGmwwEeB4DdeW"]},"project:/contracts/Interfaces/ITrustAnchorManager.sol":{"keccak256":"0x7ad86dbdeac7202c507e80fc1d9697fb6f2f7232f57a943f955a3a7708dd66f6","license":"UNLICENSED","urls":["bzz-raw://0d85612488eb53a0132f9adc867cbaf9ad371fa1c7cbd60715f2c24dd0a0f14a","dweb:/ipfs/QmYycb8MxMo3379WMw8zWmmFkCiJiu6KMEam7iFYy7nCwo"]},"project:/contracts/TrustAnchorManager.sol":{"keccak256":"0x504d4c1f790294e02bc302b0b2867815f7c1717a858a0305014645e89fbb5151","license":"UNLICENSED","urls":["bzz-raw://5ba5a434d7b3fa6048bc92b7a4c68bf6d18a6bcb26f6d5a9b94a029d4c92e721","dweb:/ipfs/QmZG5csGHGDPYafhsCrjFgxfR7bzj4D5rEvxV7Kyi9v2xd"]}},"version":1}

documentation.text: | Administrators of this contract are able to be set in order to allow for better management practices, with multi-signature support from the Administrable contract.
@dev Event for a Trust Anchor requiring multisignature permission before a Jurisdiction change.
@dev Event for getting the Jurisdiction for a Trust Anchor.
@dev Event for setting up a generic Trust Anchor's ExtraData fields.
@dev Event for setting up a unique Trust Anchor's ExtraData fields.
@dev Event for onboarding a Trust Anchor.
@dev Event for verifying a Trust Anchor.
@dev Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses the enum of TrustAnchorAccess to keep track of system permission status.
@dev Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses to Indexes.
@dev Mapping for Trust Anchor Indexes to public addresses.
@dev Number of Trust Anchors in this Trust Anchor Manager.
@dev Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses to Jurisdictions.
@dev Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses to Jurisdictions requiring permissions to change.
@dev Mapping for a generic system-wide extra data smart contract (ex: ENS-like registration for web2.0 ip addresses for data retrieval).
@dev Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses to smart contracts that define the Trust Anchor's extra data (Trust-Anchor specific data, like regulator-specific requirements).
@dev Base constant for no Jurisdiction set, the default for all Verified Trust Anchors.
@dev The Shyft Conduit public address, set post-initialization using multisignature.
@dev Initializes Trust Anchor Manager with the owner set to the calling public address.

@dev Event for a Trust Anchor requiring multisignature permission before a Jurisdiction change.
@dev Event for getting the Jurisdiction for a Trust Anchor.
@dev Event for setting up a generic Trust Anchor's ExtraData fields.
@dev Event for setting up a unique Trust Anchor's ExtraData fields.
@dev Event for onboarding a Trust Anchor.
@dev Event for verifying a Trust Anchor.
@dev Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses the enum of TrustAnchorAccess to keep track of system permission status.
@dev Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses to Indexes.
@dev Mapping for Trust Anchor Indexes to public addresses.
@dev Number of Trust Anchors in this Trust Anchor Manager.
@dev Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses to Jurisdictions.
@dev Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses to Jurisdictions requiring permissions to change.
@dev Mapping for a generic system-wide extra data smart contract (ex: ENS-like registration for web2.0 ip addresses for data retrieval).
@dev Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses to smart contracts that define the Trust Anchor's extra data (Trust-Anchor specific data, like regulator-specific requirements).
@dev Base constant for no Jurisdiction set, the default for all Verified Trust Anchors.
@dev The Shyft Conduit public address, set post-initialization using multisignature.
@dev Initializes Trust Anchor Manager with the owner set to the calling public address.

EVT_GettingJurisdictionFromTrustAnchor(u.details: Event for getting the Jurisdiction for a Trust Anchor.

EVT_JurisdictionDoesRequireChange(addres.details: Event for a Trust Anchor requiring multisignature permission before a Jurisdiction change.

EVT_onboardTrustAnchor(address).details: Event for onboarding a Trust Anchor.

EVT_setGenericTrustAnchorExtraDataAddres.details: Event for setting up a generic Trust Anchor's ExtraData fields.

EVT_setUniqueTrustAnchorExtraDataAddress.details: Event for setting up a unique Trust Anchor's ExtraData fields.

EVT_verifyTrustAnchor(address).details: Event for verifying a Trust Anchor.

approveChange(address).details: | Approves the change to a Jurisdiction for a Trust Anchor.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._trustAnchorAddress: Trust Anchor public address to confirm a change of Jurisdiction.

returns.result: | 0 = not administrator    | 1 = no trust anchor found    | 2 = no jurisdiction change necessary    | 3 = jurisdiction change occurred

changeCurrentAdminConfirmationThreshold(.details: | This function takes in an index for a proposal ot change the current administrator confirmation threshold.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._proposalIndex: The index for a specific proposal to change the current administrator confirmation threshold.

returns.result: | 0 = not an administrator    | 1 = invalid proposal index    | 2 = not enough administrators to achieve confirmation threshold    | 3 = proposal has expired    | 4 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 5 = admin confirmation threshold set

constructor.details: Initializes Trust Anchor Manager with the owner set to the calling public address.

demoteTrustAnchor(address).details: | Demotes Trust Anchor, using a public address.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._trustAnchorAddress: The smart contract address for the trust anchor that should be demoted.

returns.result: | 0 = not administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = trust anchor not verified status    | 3 = trust anchor successfully demoted

getAdminAccess(address).details: Gets the level of access for a specific administrator.

returns.result: the level of access for this administrator

getAdminConfirmationProposal(uint32).details: Gets the components of a specific NofM change proposal.

returns.adminThreshold: the threshold of the NofM voting within this proposal
returns.endTime: the end time of this proposal, after which it cannot be voted on
returns.isCompleted: whether this proposal has been completed by multisig parties

getAdminConfirmationThreshold().details: Gets the NofM threshold currently required for passing multisig votes.

getGenericTrustAnchorExtraDataAddress().details: | Gets the generic ExtraData that would be useful to all of the Trust Anchors associated to this smart contract, mediated by the administrators of this smart contract.      | An example of this "ExtraData" would be the web2.0 ip addresses that correspond to data retrieval of end user's PII according to the consent rules.

returns.result: returns the generic extraData smart contract address

getNumAdminConfirmationProposals().details: Gets the number of a specific NofM change proposal.

returns.result: the number of a specific NofM proposals

getPermissionsForMultisignKey(bytes32).details: Gets whether there have been a specific number of multisignature confirmations for a specific vote.

params._keyKeccak: A hash to reference as the key/value vote subject.

returns.result: 0 to numAdministrators = #confirmations

getTrustAnchorAddress(uint32).details: Gets the public address of a Trust Anchor, using an Index. This public address.

params._trustAnchorIndex: The Index that is checked for the public address for this Trust Anchor.

returns.result: the public address of this trust anchor

getTrustAnchorIndex(address).details: | Gets the Index of a Trust Anchor, using a public address. This Index is a simple integer value      | that relates to the order of Trust Anchors that have been onboarded into this contract.

params._trustAnchorAddress: The smart contract address that is checked for the Index for this Trust Anchor.

returns.result: | 0 -> 2^32-1 = index of trust anchor

getTrustAnchorJurisdiction(address).details: Gets the Jurisdiction for a Trust Anchor. Any invalid Trust Ancors will return 0.

params._trustAnchorAddress: Trust Anchor public address to get the Jurisdiction of.

returns.result: | 0 -> 2 ** 16 - 2 = jurisdiction found    | 2 ** 16 - 1 = no jurisdiction found

getUniqueTrustAnchorExtraDataAddress(add.details: | Gets the "ExtraData" smart contract address for a Trust Anchor. This points to another smart contract which can handle variable data that can evolve over time without impacting this contract, mediated by the Trust Anchor themselves.      | Some examples of this "ExtraData" would be any local regulatory requirements (web 2.0 links, embedded files, signatures from regulators, etc) that would need to be fulfilled, other examples would include smart contract addresses that link to blockchain systems that are not Shyft but are compliance-related.

params._trustAnchorAddress: Trust Anchor public address to get the Jurisdiction of.

returns.result: the smart contract address associated to a specific trust anchor that will contain any other data relevant to its functioning

hasTrustAnchorBeenVerified(address).details: Checks whether a Trust Anchor has ever been verified (could currently be Demoted, but must have been Verified at least once in the past), using a public address.

params._trustAnchorAddress: The smart contract address that is checked for Verified status.

returns.result: | false = has not been verified    | true = has been verified

isAdministrator(address).details: Returns whether a given address is an administrator.

params._administratorAddress: The public address of a specific administrator.

returns.result: | true = is administrator    | false = either administrator unset or demoted

isConfirmationsIsOverThreshold(uint256).details: Returns whether a reference number is over the system's administrator confirmation threshold (ie. the vote passes).

params._confirmationNumber: A number to reference as the confirmation number

returns.result: | true = is over threshold    | false = not over threshold

isPrimeRevocationManager(address).details: | The Prime Revocation Address is one which is set in the internal Shyft Core architecture.      | This Prime Revocation Address is responsible & allowed to perform revocations for edge-cases, such as a malicious Trust Anchor that has been forcibly removed from the system without it clearing its attestations beforehand.

params._primeRevocationManagerAddress: A public address to check for equality to the Prime Revocation Address.

returns.result: | true = is the prime revocation address    | false = is not the prime revocation address

isTrustAnchorVerified(address).details: Checks whether a Trust Anchor is verified, using a public address.

params._trustAnchorAddress: The smart contract address that is checked for Verified status.

returns.result: | false = not verified    | true = is verified

onboardTrustAnchor(address).details: | Onboards a Trust Anchor, using a public address.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._trustAnchorAddress: The smart contract address for the trust anchor that should be onboarded.

returns.result: | 0 = not administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = trust anchor not unknown status, or is zero address    | 3 = trust anchor onboarded

promoteAdministrator(address).details: | Promotes a new administrator. If there is only a primary Administrator set, this will allow the addition of the second administrator and enable multisignature requirements for any actions of this contract (or those inheriting it).      | Uses Multi-signature permissions if there is more than one Administrator onboarded.

returns.result: | 0 = not administrator    | 1 = administrator already promoted    | 2 = new administrator promoted    | 3 = added vote to promote administrator

proposeChangeCurrentAdminConfirmationThr.details: This function proposes a change to the threshold of voting required (N signatories of M total set size = NofM). To prevent stale inattention results, timeout after 2 days.

params._newThreshold: The new threshold (N of M multisig) that is needed to be passed.

returns.result: | 0 = not an administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators to achieve confirmation threshold    | 2 = new proposal added

revokeAdministrator(address).details: | Revokes an existing administrator from the multisignature set, checks to see if the # of required votes would be higher then the administrator set size, and if so adjusts to match.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions if there is more than one Administrator onboarded.

returns.result: result

setGenericTrustAnchorExtraDataAddress(ad.details: | Sets the generic ExtraData that would be useful to all of the Trust Anchors associated to this smart contract, mediated by the administrators of this smart contract.      | An example of this "ExtraData" would be the web2.0 ip addresses that correspond to data retrieval of end user's PII according to the consent rules.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._genericExtraDataAddress: The smart contract address that contains additional functionality/variables that are useful to the Shyft ecosystem. All Trust Anchors set up in this contract would find these useful.

returns.result: | 0 = not administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = invalid extraData address    | 3 = set generic extraData address

setPrimaryAdministrator(address).details: Sets the primary Administrator for this contract (or those that inherit from it). This transfers ownership of this contracts first administration duties (to find and onboard a second party for multisignature requirements) to the set Administrator's public address.

returns.result: | 0 = not owner    | 1 = already set first administrator    | 2 = setup first administrator

setUniqueTrustAnchorExtraDataAddress(add.details: | Sets the "ExtraData" smart contract address for a Trust Anchor. This points to another smart contract which can handle variable data that can evolve over time without impacting this contract, this function call is mediated by the Trust Anchor themselves.      | Some examples of this "ExtraData" would be any local regulatory requirements (web 2.0 links, embedded files, signatures from regulators, etc) that would need to be fulfilled, other examples would include smart contract addresses that link to blockchain systems that are not Shyft but are compliance-related.

params._uniqueExtraDataAddress: The smart contract address that contains additional functionality/variables that are useful to the Shyft ecosystem, but are not included in the generic ExtraData.

returns.result: | 0 = sender is not a valid trust anchor    | 1 = set trust anchor specific extraData

setupShyftConduit(address).details: | Links Shyft Conduit to this contract's function flow.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._shyftConduitAddress: The smart contract address for the Shyft Conduit that should be linked.

returns.result: | 0: not administrator    | 1: could not set conduit address    | 2: set conduit address

setupTrustAnchorJurisdiction(uint16).details: | Sets up a Jurisdiction for a Trust Anchor, contract is called by the Trust Anchors themselves.      | Requires multisignature approval for changing jurisdiction.

params._newJurisdiction: Jurisdiction to be set for a specific Trust Anchor.

returns.result: | 0 = not verified    | 1 = jurisdiction already set, now waiting for approval    | 2 = trust anchor jurisdiction has been set up first time

verifyTrustAnchor(address).details: | Verifies Trust Anchor, using a public address. Onboarded and Verified are seperate processes to keep track of Trust Anchors that may be temporarily Demoted.      | Also useful as the pattern 1. Onboarded -> 2. Trust Anchor sets their own "extraData" which contains details that are required (for regulations etc.) -> 3. Administrators vote to have Trust Anchors fully verified having examined the data in the extraData smart contract pointer.      | Uses Multi-signature permissions.

params._trustAnchorAddress: The smart contract address for the trust anchor that should be verified.

returns.result: | 0 = not administrator    | 1 = not enough administrators have permissioned change    | 2 = trust anchor not onboarded status    | 3 = trust anchor verified

NoJurisdiction.details: Base constant for no Jurisdiction set, the default for all Verified Trust Anchors.

genericExtraDataAddress.details: Mapping for a generic system-wide extra data smart contract (ex: ENS-like registration for web2.0 ip addresses for data retrieval).

jurisdictions.details: Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses to Jurisdictions.

jurisdictionsRequiringChange.details: Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses to Jurisdictions requiring permissions to change.

numTrustAnchors.details: Number of Trust Anchors in this Trust Anchor Manager.

shyftConduitAddress.details: The Shyft Conduit public address, set post-initialization using multisignature.

trustAnchorAccess.details: Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses the enum of TrustAnchorAccess to keep track of system permission status.

trustAnchorIndexToAddressMap.details: Mapping for Trust Anchor Indexes to public addresses.

trustAnchorIndexes.details: Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses to Indexes.

uniqueExtraDataAddress.details: Mapping for Trust Anchor public addresses to smart contracts that define the Trust Anchor's extra data (Trust-Anchor specific data, like regulator-specific requirements).

changeCurrentAdminConfirmationThreshold(.notice: Multiple proposals can be constructed for different sets to apply to change the administrator threshold. As the permissions for multisig keys use a voting set nonce underneath the hood, a change in the current administrator set will cancel all current votes.

getPermissionsForMultisignKey(bytes32).notice: Uses composition features (based on current validator set) so data structure may be orphaned when promotion/demotion events occur.

promoteAdministrator(address).notice: | Uses composition features (based on current validator set) so data structure may be orphaned when promotion/demotion events occur.         | Whenever this function is called (with a passing vote), there will be a re-hashing of the voting set nonce, so all current votes will become invalidated.

revokeAdministrator(address).notice: | Uses composition features (based on current validator set) so data structure may be orphaned when promotion/demotion events occur.         | Whenever this function is called (with a passing vote), there will be a re-hashing of the voting set nonce, so all current votes will become invalidated.

userdoc.notice: | Administrators of this contract are able to be set in order to allow for better management practices, with multi-signature support from the Administrable contract.
